metadata.title: CASE 287/04: Pristina Airport – Alleged Administrative Irregularity Regarding an X-RAY Tender

overview: This investigation report examines an alleged administrative irregularity regarding an X-ray tender at Pristina Airport (Case 287/04) under UNMIK. Issues arose due to the contract being signed prematurely before obtaining the necessary capital approval.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Assembly of Kosovo – Law on Public Financial Management and Accountability 2003/2
Assembly of Kosovo – Law on Public Procurement in Kosovo 2003/17

methodology.description: The investigation involved conducting interviews, reviewing documents, and analyzing pertinent procurement and financial regulations.

background.context: On 2003-03-07, Pristina Airport launched an international tender for X-ray equipment. The contract was awarded on 2003-04-04 to a vendor that met all technical requirements but was not the lowest bidder. Administrative process concerns arose during the contract finalization without prior capital expenditure approval.
timeline: 2003-06-19: Capital Expenditure approval date;2003-06-20: Official sign-off

investigation_details.subject: Administrative irregularities regarding X-ray Tender at Pristina Airport

allegations.description: Contract signed prior to formal capital expenditure approval.
allegations.findings: Evidence indicates that the contract was signed before the capital expenditure request was approved by KTA, but no compensable damages were found.

allegations.description: Letter of Notification signed before obtaining necessary approvals.
allegations.findings: The Divisional Manager signed the notification before obtaining KTA's formal Capital Expenditure approval.

findings: The signing by the Divisional Manager prior to formal approval was a minor administrative irregularity.
No financial loss to Pristina Airport or KTA was discovered.

actions: Ensure adequate training for airport staff involved in procurement activities.
Airport staff must strictly adhere to all applicable Procurement Regulations.
Written approval must be obtained prior to signing contract-related documentation for capital expenditures.
